Expertized areas : iPhone developer, Android developer, Mobile framework developer, Mobile enterprise application developer, iPhone animations, Android animations, Mobile native credit card processing, Mobile PayPal integration, etc...

jobs.jobTitle: Senior Mobile Software Engineer / Tech Lead
jobs.description:
Key Responsibilities 
 
• Design the main architecture of mobile applications with detailed technical components. 
• Evaluate detailed business, functional, and high-level technical requirements including recovery, security, and audit. 
• Prepare the development plan according to the requirements gathered/finalised from clients. 
• Distribute responsibilities among the team members based on skills and other factors. 
• Provide management leadership in the development and delivery of iOS and Android native applications. 
• Ensure development activities are aligned with scope, schedule, priority and business objectives. 
• Review software developments of whole team, and guide to correct direction while maintaining a development standard. 
• Always make sure the software projects come in on time and under the estimated budget. 
• Communicating with clients continuously to keep them updated and provides technical consultancy for their requirements. 
• Ensure the delivered solution meets the technical specifications and design requirements.

Key Responsibilities 
 
• Development of mobile applications for multiple eCommerce properties on mobile platforms, integrating to various internal and external API services. 
• Work with UX engineers and designers to produce best outcome. 
• Responsible for continued enhancement and maintenance of production mobile software. 
• Develop robust and properly tested implementations, and ensure successful production deployments with minimal defects. 
• Work with other engineers to create and maintain efficient and viable practices throughout the software development life cycle. 
• Playing the role of scrum master in agile environment

Key Responsibilities 
 
• Write new software, make modifications to existing software, and integrate software applications and modules in accordance with agreed upon specifications. 
• Best possible suggestions for problem solutions or software enhancements. 
• Implement/Develop application solutions as directed within standards. 
• Participate in agile planning sessions with team members to analyse development requirements, provide design options, and provide estimates of work. 
• Develop Android applications with enterprise API services. 
• Directly work with clients to achieve best outcome of the project. 
• Developing enterprise web applications using Google Web Toolkit (GWT®) and JSP, EJB, Hibernate frameworks.

Key Responsibilities 
 
• Develop software using disciplined software development processes, adhering to team/company standards and software best practice guidelines, and corporate policies. 
• Work with the development team to develop mainly government pension web application. 
• Contributed to system reporting module of government pension application using Open Office java UNO API. 
• Mainly developed systems using J2EE with Hibernate framework and Oracle database. 
• Participate in agile planning sessions with team members to analyse development requirements, provide design options, and provide estimates of work. 
• Assist QA engineers about system architecture and reporting module to continue with testing process.
- Developing java enterprise applications using JPA, EJB, Hibernate frameworks.

Project descriptionThis is the home of Project Redbox. The aim of Redbox is to provide an elegantly orchestrated and simply connected F&ID business to our Clients. Redbox's vision is to be both a single client portal and smart platform that can coordinate Fraud and ID products across the Experian suite and provide end-to-end client solutions.
This elegance and coordination will not come quickly or easily, which is why the Redbox project is split into two phases. The first phase will run through May 2016 and deliver a minimum viable product with a single client access point.

See project RedBoxSee project
Project nameAdTruth Resolver
Jul 2014

Project descriptionMarketers are inefficient in their ad spend since they are not able to reliably target individuals due to web access channels (e.g. multiple browsers, native apps) and device proliferation. These inefficiencies can be due to factors such as poor conversion analytics, too broadly targeted media or not reaching a customer during their decision journey. 
Zander is creating an id for each device and household that can be reliably targeted and analyzed when only anonymous data is present. In addition, Zander will support client supplied attributes such as one way hashed identifiers that are representative of PII. Zander is using all available ids as inputs to create the device level ID. 

Technologies: Java, Spring, PostgreSQL, NoSQL (Aerospike), Amazon Web Services, RabbitMQ, DropWizard, JUnit

Other creators
Asanka Umesh Iroshana Ambalakande Gedara

ICharts
Sep 2014

Project descriptionIt's a cloud based application which runs on top of Apache Stratos, which lets the user to upload an image of a table which should obviously have rows and columns. It can be either a printed document or even a hand written one. Thereafter the image will be stored into the Amazon's S3 cloud storage, from where the "Optical Character Recognition" is being used to convert those tables into charts which could be an interactive way of analyzing. Finally the user will be able to download those charts as an image, as a pdf and so on. So this application basically allows the users to convert tables into charts.

Project nameA Javascript Visualizer and Analyzer
Jan 2014 – Jan 2016

Project descriptionWebsite development is one of the most prominent development areas in software development industry. Developing and maintaining a web site is a difficult task due to the increasing complexity of web site development. The most popular programming language is JavaScript. It is highly dynamic and weakly typed language. Therefore, development tools which are currently available for JavaScript still haven’t reached a level on which the developers can rely on. The main reason for this is that JavaScript frameworks are being developed faster with different architectures and therefore, JavaScript helper tools can become obsolete as soon as new frameworks are introduced.

There are helper tools available which would analyze a given JavaScript file or generate a call graph for a JavaScript file or generate a dependency graph for a given web site project. However, some of them are no longer supported and most of them depend on other libraries like JavaScript parsers and therefore, those dependencies are needed to run them, which can be a usability problem. Furthermore, none of the previous work or currently available tools were able to generate a call graph dynamically while the website was running, which would immensely facilitate in debugging the web site.

Project descriptionTransbridge is designed to plug any ATM network and core banking backend. Financial institutes need a bridge to connect back end with third party ATMs. ATMs communicate with their backend via ISO 8583 messages.
ISO Transabridge is designed to break and construct ISO 8583 messages. It is a matter of time to implement interfaces to break vendor specific ISO formats and backend transaction handling. We have followed Factory and Proxy design patterns to overcome the issue of connecting ATM networks and back end.
The product is released with a monitoring tool and ISO message generator. Monitoring tool is used to monitor sever status and transaction history. ISO message generator is designed to act as ATM for testing connectivity and transactions.
Software/ Technology Used:
• Java 1.7 , Spring core/Dao
• Sl4j / logback - logging
• JUnit - unit testing
• Maven 3 project management
• Sonar - code quality

general.description:
I am a Senior Software Engineer with more than 5 years of experience in developing industrial level solution using .Net web technologies like SharePoint, ASP.Net..etc. I have worked in globally renowned software solution providing companies like Virtusa, Totalamber, WebQuarters and work for some major clients like United Technology Cooperation(USA), ShowCor, Coveris, KF Aerospace(Canada). I have also recognized as Subject Matter Expert for Nintex Tools that runs top of SharePoint since I have experienced worked in several Nintex projects till now.

Recently i have being part of the project team and playing major role solution that we developed for Heroux Devtek that Migrated millions of documents into searchable format (OCR) into SharePoint Online, also we have changed the information architecture into suitable manner. Also I have led project of KF Aerospace, to manage Snag Requests(MRO) on client site in Canada. I focused on developing a middleware/frontend to existing MRO system build on Infor M3 framework using ASP.Net and JQuery with some enhancements to existing system. project concludes with successful user trial, taking part with actual stakeholders of their business. Currently involving in internal product developed by company itself using latest ASP.Net and JQuery technologies.

Colleagues known me as a technical guy and I also try to get best out me on technical terms by understanding what business needs. I also like to work alone, but I’m at my best as a team.

I have graduated from Sri Lanka Institute of Information Technology in 2012 as a Bachelor of Science (Special) in IT (Specialized in Software Engineering)

Project descriptionIn this online CV system we provide facilities to undergraduates to maintain their own profile while they are studying in the university. They can include their details in their own profile and specially their academic qualifications. These unique profiles must be updated daily by either undergraduates or the universities .We ensures that only these two parties can update the profiles. As an example, when a student finishes his/her level -2 in the university, the relevant department or the faculty has the authority to update the profile mentioning the course modules and the grades, that student have obtained. If a student follows an external course they can update their own profiles with that information but they have to prove it by including references. The most important fact is that the system provides the facility to employer companies to know whether the profile is updated by the student or the university. 
When the students leave the university after their graduation they have a complete profile with every necessary details. As a result of that employer companies who are willing to work with fresh and young employees can easily get the information regarding the available CV s on the system .The system has the advantage of finding the employees with qualifications by a filtering system. As an example, a company wants to have a new employee who is capable of web developing, programming with 2-year experience in industry. The company only has to enter these qualifications and submit it on to the system. It immediately gives the list of employees who have those qualifications. And by pressing a one single button they can get the printed CV of that employee.Ultimate Transport System for Buses
Feb 2012 – Mar 2012

Project descriptionAs everyone knows well, there can't be seen a proper time scheduled transportation system in Sri Lanka. Still many people meet with huge difficulties when they want to find the time tables of those systems. So we came up with a solution for that and we implemented this product in the Colombo Hackathon - The first ever hackathon in Sri Lanka. Simply we use a mobile application and we use Android mobile development and USSD technologies in the mobile application. Main server is run in java Tomcat server. We plan to introduce this product to customers near future through the help of Etiselat mobile partners in Sri Lanka.Automated Message System for Education institutes
Aug 2010 – Jul 2011

Project descriptionThe aim of this project is to develop an Automatic messaging system for students and academic staff members of Universities and Institutes to send and receive academic information through the SMS technology among them and develop a database to store the student’s information. This system will work as a bridge between students and members of the academic staff.
